The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#23462](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23462) (test: Enable SC2046 and SC2086 shellcheck rules by hebasto)
* [#
Concept ACK. Does the ci print the log on failure?

Updated 95b5dfa4da8c876c7c1e9e0bbc8ae9ccb97c9370 -> 68459dd31ad6dced394ae6d5d4bd07fe3fd8f510 ([pr19952.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19952.01) -> [pr19952.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19952.02)):

- addressed @MarcoFalke's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19952#issuecomment-702658581):
> Concept ACK. Does the ci print the log on failure

Concept ACK, I think not being verbose unless the level of detail is really needed (say, on a failure) is good for build/test commands. Makes it easier to spot actual problems.\nPlease do make it easy to figure out where the logs went in case they're needed though :slightly_smiling_face:

Updated 4b676b1757a397ea39e6fabff42c3b30c4489630 -> 46e2ff7c0dd4d15d17dc6d9015f28191d3efc05b ([pr19952.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19952.03) -> [pr19952.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19952.04)):

- rebased on top of the recent CI changes
- addressed @laanwj's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19952#issuecomment-730834978):

> Please

Hmmm, I've been thinking about this... And wondering if we could use `tee` and process substitute to do:

```diff
diff --git a/depends/funcs.mk b/depends/funcs.mk
index 3ddeaf0378..2de5f67b5c 100644
--- a/depends/funcs.mk
+++ b/depends/funcs.mk
@@ -80,7 +80,7 @@ $(1)_download_path_fixed=$(subst :,\:,$$($(1)_download_path))
 # The default behavior for tar will try to set ownership w

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
üêô This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>
Could you add more details? For example, where would we expect these log files to appear?
So this would mean that while the `$(1)_*_cmds` is running, we wouldn't see any logs, and only if the `cmds` fail, would we `cat` the logs? Am I understanding this correctly?
Yes, you're correct. This behavior is applied only when `LOG` is set.\n\n
To apply `$(1)_logging` to `$(1)_preprocess_cmds` even the latter is not set explicitly.
If wording in the updated OP is ok, I'll push it into the docs.
